title: COVID-19 Vaccine Communications for Children and Families
description: The resources below help to promote COVID-19 vaccination among pregnant and breastfeeding people, parents, children, and youth, including children and youth with special health needs.
cleaned_text: The resources below help to promote COVID-19 vaccination among pregnant and breastfeeding people, parents, children, and youth, including children and youth with special health needs. - This page, COVID-19 Vaccine Communications for Children and Families, is offered by - [Bureau of Family Health and Nutrition](/orgs/bureau-of-family-health-and-nutrition) - - [Department of Public Health](/orgs/department-of-public-health) COVID-19 Vaccine Communications for Children and Families Table of Contents Information for partners and providers Information for parents and caregivers Find information on COVID-19 vaccines for children and youth, boosters, safety, and more. [COVID-19 Vaccine FAQ:](/info-details/covid-19-vaccine-frequently-asked-questions)Frequently asked questions and answers regarding COVID-19 vaccination. This page has useful information for before you get vaccinated, during your vaccine appointment, and after you receive the vaccine, as well as information about vaccine safety. [Children & Youth with Special Health Needs and the COVID-19 Vaccine:](/info-details/children-youth-with-special-health-needs-and-the-covid-19-vaccine)Frequently asked questions on COVID-19 vaccine with a focus on children & youth with complex medical needs. [Trust the Facts, Get the Vax campaign materials:](/resource/trust-the-facts-get-the-vax-campaign-materials)TV ads, animated videos and other materials for the Commonwealth's multilingual public awareness campaign to promote the safety and efficacy of the COVID-19 vaccine.
